document.heading: Nominating Petitions Signature Amendment Act of 2001

history.narrative: Law 14-43, the “Nominating Petitions Signature Amendment Act of 2001”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 14-103, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 5, 2001, and June 26, 2001, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 24, 2001, it was assigned Act No. 14-109 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 14-43 became effective on October 26, 2001.
